intro: Coburgia quitensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions. Coburgia quitensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
